snippet: “America Today,” which depicts life just before the Great Depression, will go on display when the Met takes over the Whitney’s Marcel Breuer building on Madison Avenue.
abstract: AXA Equitable donates Thomas Hart Benton's iconic 10-panel mural America Today, which depicts panoply of pre-Depression American types, to Metropolitan Museum of Art; museum plans to display piece when it takes over Whitney's Marcel Breuer building on Madison Avenue in 2015.
lead_paragraph: “America Today,” which depicts life just before the Great Depression, will go on display when the Met takes over the Whitney’s Marcel Breuer building on Madison Avenue.

headline.seo: Thomas Hart Benton’s ‘America Today’ Mural Goes to Met
headline.main: Thomas Hart Benton Masterwork Goes to Met
